creator: ted@freedomvoice.com
text:
The Following format of the VirtualHost directive causes a errorless startup 
failure in httpd.

<VirtualHost 192.168.0.18>

The conf file this was in worked for 2.0.49 but would quietly fail under 
2.0.50. The command apachectl start would take only a fraction of a second to 
return the prompt. No messages on the console, nothing in the logs.

This was fixed with the following:

<VirtualHost 192.168.0.18:80>

One would think I failed to...

Listen 80

But one would be wrong in doing so. Not to forget this same conf worked 
under .49. It may be something silly, or it could be that the format wasn't 
legal and .50 set things straight. Never the less I thought I should mention 
it. Should you need the conf file please email me. I think I'll spare this 
forum the full 1498 lines of love.

I would like to thank all of the developers of apache, and other contributors. 
There is no other env I would rather work in!

Ted

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
There *was* a crash at startup in 2.0.50 with no Listen statements, which
doesn't sound coincidental.  Is the issue stillreproducible with 2.0.52?  Do you
have any NameVirtualHost settings as well?

If it's a crash, can you run "gdb  --args /path/to/httpd -X" and enter "run"
then "backtrace" when the server crashes?

creator: nick@webthing.com
text: No response to NEEDINFO; presuming long-since expired.
